name: axios
text:
President Trump spoke out against a "merciless campaign" to wipe out American history during a Fourth of July celebration at Mount Rushmore on Friday.

He said a "left-wing cultural revolution is designed to overthrow the American Revolution."

https://t.co/AHS5SZ1wpp

name: axios
text:
Conservative Texas powerbroker Steve Hotze asked Texas Gov. Greg Abbott to instruct the National Guard to "shoot to kill" rioters as thousands around the country protested the police killing of George Floyd.

https://t.co/5gNVH1n2aP

name: axios
text:
Interim Aurora, Colo., police chief Vanessa Wilson fired two officers for reenacting the death of 23-year-old Elijah McClain and a third officer for commenting on the photo that captured the "despicable act."

https://t.co/IZnBcsKeFI

name: axios
text:
31 Major League Baseball players and seven staff members from 19 of the 30 teams tested positive for the coronavirus just as teams resumed workouts for the first time since March. 

https://t.co/5vrnluqNkz

name: axios
text:
Trump has signed off on giving businesses another five weeks to apply for funds through the Paycheck Protection Program.

https://t.co/LjB7upEueh

name: axios
text:
Mexican leaders are calling for stronger enforcement on its northern border as the number of coronavirus cases in the southwestern U.S. continues to rise.

https://t.co/sykOzh9cxH

name: axios
text:
The U.S. has reached new highs in single-day coronavirus infections for three consecutive days this week.
